statement.p: Explain why the vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ 5 \\ -4 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 3 \\ -4 \\ 0 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -4 \\ 5 \\ 0 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -18 \\ 3 \\ 17 \\ -8 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 7 \\ -1 \\ -9 \\ 4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent or linearly independent.

answer.p: The vectors \left[\begin{array}{r} -3 \\ 4 \\ 5 \\ -4 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 4 \\ 3 \\ -4 \\ 0 \\ -6 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} 0 \\ -4 \\ 5 \\ 0 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{r} -18 \\ 3 \\ 17 \\ -8 \\ 9 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{r} 7 \\ -1 \\ -9 \\ 4 \\ 0 \end{array}\right] are linearly dependent .
